channel.title: Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) vaccine on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections
channel.description: Recent content in Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) vaccine on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections

item.title: A Population-Based Evaluation of a Publicly Funded, School-Based HPV Vaccine Program in British Columbia, Canada: Parental Factors Associated with HPV Vaccine Receipt
item.description: More educated parents more often refused HPV vaccines for their daughters. (Canada)

item.title: Acceptance of human papillomavirus vaccination among Californian parents of daughters: a representative statewide analysis
item.description: Parents with higher education and conservatives rarely allowed their daughters to get vaccinated against HPV. Parents who did not finish school, Catholics and liberals more often allowed their daughters to have this vaccination. (California, United States)

item.title: Predictors of HPV vaccine acceptability: a theory-informed, systematic review
item.description: A systematic review of 28 studies showed the higher the level of education of parents, the more often they refused the HPV vaccine.
